items.question: Is "Finding Nemo" based on a book?
items.answer: Andrew Stanton wrote the storyline for Finding Nemo that was eventually turned into a screenplay by Stanton and fellow screenwriters Bob Peterson and David Reynolds.

items.question: What happened to Marlin's family?
items.answer: Coral dashes into the cave, the barracuda pounces, Marlin screams, "NO!", then the barracuda shields him off and continues pouncing and then slaps him away from its sights, and causes Marlin to become a widower of Coral and overprotective of Nemo.

items.question: Why do the Lobsters have a New England accent?
items.answer: While most voices in the movie have Australian accents, the lobsters have a New England accent as a tip to the director (Andrew Stanton)'s childhood in Rockport, Massachusetts. (The part of the Lobster is also played by Stanton.) References also exist elsewhere to Rockport and to Stanton's father's boat.

items.question: What species of fish are Marlin, Nemo and Dory? What other species of fish are in the movie?
items.answer: Marlin & Nemo are both clownfish. Dory is a Pacific regal blue tang or more commonly, a blue tang. Other species that don't have speaking parts are the barracuda that attacks Marlin & Coral in the opening scene, a flounder (flatfish), the minke whale that swallows our heroes and many others.

items.question: Is there an extra scene during or after the end credits?
items.answer: Yes, There is an extra scene after the end credits

items.question: Any recommendations for other movies by Pixar Animation Studios?
items.answer: If you like Pixar's animation in Finding Nemo, you'll certainly want to see its sequel— (2016)—and some of the other Pixar productions, including Toy Story (1995) (1995) and its sequels—Toy Story 2 (1999) (1999) and Toy Story 3 (2010) (2010)—and perhaps A Bug's Life (1998) (1998), Monsters, Inc. (2001) (2001), The Incredibles (2004) (2004), Cars (2006) (2006) and Cars 2 (2011) (2011), Ratatouille (2007) (2007), WALL·E (2008) (2008), Up (2009) (2009) and Brave (2012). Edit
